meanings.definition: A type of protein found in the retina of the eye that is sensitive to light.
meanings.sent1: Rhodopsins help our eyes detect light.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study rhodopsins to understand how our eyes work.
meanings.sent3: The rhodopsins in our eyes throw a party when the sun rises.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny light sensors, rhodopsins guide our vision.
meanings.sent5: The delicate rhodopsins dance with light, revealing the world to us.

meanings.definition: The pigments responsible for the absorption of light in the photoreceptor cells of the retina.
meanings.sent1: Rhodopsins play a crucial role in capturing light for our vision.
meanings.sent2: The colors we see are processed by rhodopsins in our eyes.
meanings.sent3: When rhodopsins get too much light, they throw shade at each other.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of darkness, rhodopsins shine like beacons.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant rhodopsins paint our world with hues of light and shadow.
